intro: Securidaca diversifolia var. mollis, commonly known as soft-leaved sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale blue, arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
